Package server.model.character

Class Character

java.lang.Object
server.model.character.Character
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
public abstract class Character
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
It corresponds to the tokens that will be moved on the board during the game.
Version:
1.0
Author:
axel gauthier
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • Character

      public Character​(int maxHP, java.lang.String name, Coordinates coords, Army army, int maxArmor, int damagePoints, Board board, char symbol)
      Constructor for an usual character
      Parameters:
      maxHP - the maximum health points
      name - the name
      coords - the coordinates on the board
      army - the army
      maxArmor - the maximum armor points
      damagePoints - the damage points
      board - the board where the character is playing on

  • Method Details

    • goTo

      public int goTo​(Cell destination, boolean haveToFight, ClientWrapper[] players)
      Try to move the character to the destination cell. If a fight has to happen, the character will firstly try to win the fight and then, move on the cell. Otherwise it will just go
      Parameters:
      destination - the destination cell
      haveToFight - the information that a fight has to start or not
      Returns:
      a return code: 0 - The character didn't have to fight and went directly on the destination 1 - A fight has started and the attacker won 2 - A fight has started and the attacker loose

    • addTreasure

      public void addTreasure​(Treasure reward)
      Add a treasure to the character list
      Parameters:
      reward - the treasure to add

    • equipTreasure

      public int equipTreasure​(Treasure toEquip)
      Equip the wanted treasure. It means that this treasure will be taken of the treasure list and the character will receive the effects contained inside the treasure
      Parameters:
      toEquip - the treasure to equip
      Returns:
      a return code: 0 - The treasure has successfully been equipped 1 - The treasure is not inside the treasure list of the character

    • strike

      public boolean strike​(Character attacked)
      A character will attack another one.
      Parameters:
      attacked - the attacked character
      Returns:
      the return code of the takeDamages() methods

    • takeDamages

      public boolean takeDamages​(int damages)
      Remove the damages point received to the character. The result of the action depends on the presence or not of armor.
      Parameters:
      damages - the damages points received
      Returns:
      true if the character is considered as dead and false if not

    • isDead

      public boolean isDead()
      Return if a character is considered dead or not
      Returns:
      true if the character is considered as dead and false if not

    • addHP

      public void addHP​(int hp)
      Add health points to the character. Could not add more health points than defined in the maxHP attribute
      Parameters:
      hp - the health points to add

    • addArmor

      public void addArmor​(int armor)
      Add armor points to the character. Could not add more armor points than defined in the maxArmor attribute
      Parameters:
      armor - the armor points to add

    • addDamage

      public void addDamage​(int damages)
      Add damage points to the character
      Parameters:
      damages - the damage points to add

    • kill

      public void kill()
      Remove the character from its army

    • heal

      public void heal()
      Health completely the character

      Getter of army

      Parameters:
      army - the army to set

    • isAPossibleMove

      public abstract boolean isAPossibleMove​(Cell destination)
      Return if the destination cell is reachable according to the character type
      Parameters:
      destination - the destination cell
      Returns:
      true if the character can go on the cell or not

    • dumpCharacter

      public abstract java.lang.String dumpCharacter()
      Give a description of the character
      Returns:
      the character name, its type, the army which its belongs and its coordinates
